name: The Millennium Memory Project
description: It began with a simple question: Do you remember where you were and what you were doing on the night of December 31, 1999? It became a hybrid work of data journalism and oral history, and a fascinating look at our memories from the turn of the millennium.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, D3.js, AngularJS, Illustrator, Premier Pro, Audition, Qualtrics (survey software), Mechanical Turk
fileUnder: web development, journalism, data visualization, graphic design, audio, video

name: The Best-Selling Writers of All Time
description: The list of best-selling fiction authors of all time reads like a potboiler in its own right; it's full of surprise and intrigue. Three of the top four writers in the list are women, and you've probably never heard of one of them. One writer in the chart admitted to plagiarizing another in 1997. Another author was killed in a duel. Dive in with this interactive infographic.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, D3.js

name: CIA Data: In Bubbles
description: The CIA created the World Factbook as a classified document in 1962. They released it to the public in 1971, and it's now one of the leading sources of statistics on each of the world's 195 sovereign nations and 59 dependent territories. This website is a visualization of that data.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, D3.js, AngularJS

name: 2016 U.S. Senate Elections
description: As the U.S. Senate elections approached in 2016, I wondered: How many of the candidates went to Harvard? How many of them were lawyers? This interactive app provided answers to those questions and more.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, AngularJS

name: How The Money Moves
description: I built this website as a project at UNC. I had two goals: 1) Produce a work of data journalism with at least three visualizations; and 2) emulate the style of a major news publication. To accomplish the first goal, I combed through U.S. census data and found some interesting trends in the migration patterns of Americans at different income levels. For the second objective, I chose to emulate the style of FiveThirtyEight (as it looked in fall 2015). The resemblance is purely for educational purposes.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, HighCharts.js, cartoDB

name: Fingers: Fact & Fiction
description: Ever wonder where the word 'pinky' comes from? Why do most people wear wedding rings on the third finger of their left hand? The answers to these questions and more can be found in this interactive slider.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery

name: What I'm Probably Doing Right Now
description: I'm a private investigator, freelance journalist, and the father of three kids. My schedule varies widely depending on the day and time. So I built a custom, analog SVG clock that updates my status.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, Illustrator, JavaScript

name: The Website You're Looking At Right Now
description: In case you're wondering, I built this website, too. Might as well mention it.
skills: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, AngularJS (so that I could display six different menus of projects with just a few lines of code), Illustrator, Audition (for the sound effects)

name: A Lesson In Honeysuckle
description: Honeysuckle is celebrated almost like no other plant, especially in the South. But few people realize that it's actually an invasive weed.
skills: Published in 'Southern Things' magazine, Fall 2015

name: Happy Strangers Singing: An Ethnography
description: In 2015, I wrote an ethnography of PopUp Chorus, an ad hoc vocal group that invites people to show up on the spot and sing pop and indie rock songs. Exactly who were these people? Why did they do it? Why was it so much damn fun? I spent four months finding out.
skills: This was part of a graduate ethnography class at the University of North Carolina. Additional chapters can be provided upon request.

name: UI/UX Personas
description: I took a UI/UX class during my graduate studies, and I was required to create personas for the potential visitors of each website I designed during the semester. I quickly discovered two things: 1) writing personas is fun; and 2) they are an invaluable part of the design process. Today, I still try to create personas before writing a single line of code in a web app.
skills: My 12 years of experience as a corporate investigator, writing the biographies of thousands of plaintiffs in product liability lawusits, gives me a unique vantage point on Americans and their online habits.

name: Millennium Memory Project: Interactive Cartoons
description: For the Millennium Memory Project, I drew cartoons in Illustrator, exported them as SVG code, and dropped the code into my HTML files. This allowed me to create interactive graphics (e.g., a VHS video player with working control buttons).
skills: Adobe Illustrator, JavaScript, jQuery

name: An Ethnopoetic Transcription of PopUp Chorus
description: I made this poster during an ethnography of PopUp Chorus, an ad hoc vocal group in Durham, North Carolina, in 2015. The goal was to capture the style and essence of the choir director's speech -- his pitch, cadence, and inflection -- with just words. The transcription covers a moment from a rehearsal of Roberta Flack's hit, 'Killing Me Softly With His Song.'
skills: Adobe Illustrator

name: Fingers: Fact & Fiction
description: To create the illustrations for an educational slider about fingers, I took high-contrast photos of my own hand and used Adobe Shape (now called Adobe Capture CC) to turn them into vector graphics. I then washed over the images with pastel colors and added an art deco font to give the slides a retro look.
skills: Adobe Shape, Illustrator

name: Album Cover
description: Years ago, I wrote and recorded an album's worth of songs in my bedroom in Austin, Texas. I used the lyrics to make a self-portrait for the album cover. Most of the songs were embarassing -- confessional, singer-songwriter crap -- but I still like the artwork.
skills: Adobe Illustrator

name: What We Remember: A Slidecast
description: As part of my master's thesis at the University of North Carolina, I conducted an oral history of the turn of the millennium. I interviewed 37 people, from all walks of life, and recorded more than five and a half hours of audio. An unexpected theme emerged from people's memories. This slidecast tells the story.
skills: Zoom h4n digital recorder, Adobe Audition, Premiere Pro

name: Songs About Sex, Murder and Celebrity
description: I was on a big songwriting kick a few years ago and wrote about 50 tunes (see the album cover in the Graphics section). I put some of my favorites up on SoundCloud. Music is still my mistress, but these days I don't have much time to sneak off and fool around. That's not me in the photo. In a weird way, though, I wish it was.
skills: Cubase, Audition, piano, guitar, harmonica

name: Triangle Tango Regatta
description: What you get when you put a photographer in a jon boat on choppy waters with a 70-200 lens and a plastic bag? This.
skills: Canon EOS 70D DSLR camera, lenses (18-55mm, 50mm prime and 70-200mm), Adobe Lightroom and Photoshop

name: Motherhood
description: I think that photojournalism -- and photography in general -- are at their best when they show something you wouldn't have seen otherwise. The familiar becomes strange, and you get that odd feeling that your spying. I tried to create that experience in this photostory assigment at UNC in 2015.
skills: Canon EOS 70D DSLR camera, 18-55mm lens, Speedlite external flash, Adobe Lightroom and Photoshop

name: A Picture of Dignity
description: Paul Lee can't go into a gas station in Roanoke Rapids, North Carolina, without turning heads. The reason why is both simple and sublime.
skills: I made this short documentary for the 2015 Carolina Photojournalism Workshop.
